chunks.title: Introduction to JavaScript Installing Node.js
chunks.text: Guys, in today's video, we are going to start JavaScript.

text: Guys, in today's video, we are going to start JavaScript. JavaScript is a client-side scripting language which makes your web pages interactive. JavaScript can be used to make backends with the help of Node.js which we are definitely going to see in this course. You guys like this video and write JavaScript in the comment section below if you are excited for JavaScript this time. Let's go to the computer screen and see JavaScript. We will install Node.js. It's going to be fun. Let's roll the intro. So guys, as you can see, I have come to my computer screen. I am going to open a folder named video54 in VS Code. It's going to be fun here because we are using JavaScript now and we are taking a transition towards a full stack. First of all, I will give you a boilerplate template and I will write JavaScript introduction here. And I will tell you what JavaScript is. Let's say we have a website here. And I click on this website somewhere. And I want to see an alert box when I click. How will we do that? We will do that with the help of JavaScript. I made this website for you guys. Netflix.com In fact, I will open it once and show it. We will revisit it. And we will talk about it. So if I open it with code, then this folder will open in VS Code. And if I preview index.html, then you can see it like this. But there are some things missing here. Like if I click on this button, then nothing is happening. I would like to put my email address here. Then this form will be submitted by clicking on the start button. Such things are done with JavaScript. By the way, we have done the clone. We have also done the design. Everything is completely chipped. The website is responsive too. But we could not add interactivity to it. And where will interactivity come from? Interactivity will come with the help of JavaScript. So what kind of interactivity does JavaScript give you guys? JavaScript gives us all kinds of interactivity. Like you guys will want to click on the button and submit a form, that will also happen. If you guys want to click somewhere, then a user will see a prompt, that will also happen. If you want to open another page by clicking somewhere, that will also happen. Everything will happen. So all these things are done by JavaScript. To use JavaScript, if I want to use JavaScript in my computer, for learning purpose, I have two ways. One is that I use it on the front end. And the other is that I use it on the back end. I told you guys about front end and back end in my very first video. In which I told you guys that there is a client, which is us. And this client asks Google Chrome to bring this website to me. And this website reaches out to the server. And by reaching out to the server, the server gives back the response. Which is given back to the client. So this computing on the server, that can also be done through JavaScript. And for that, we will install Node.js. But if we want, whatever we are doing, it should be done here in our browser. That means we don't have to go anywhere. So for that, the JavaScript code will be written here. Let me explain what is the difference between the two. If you don't understand. Suppose I have a very simple website. And I write here div.box. By the way, there is no need to write div.box. I can only write box. But I have become used to it. I write div.box only. But I am telling you, if you write only dot box, then div will come. And if I write here, Hey, I am a box. So I can style this box. I will not show you by doing that. So I will add a script here before closing the body tag. And what I will do inside this script, I will write alert. And I will write hello world. Okay. And I can write my JavaScript here. When I write alert hello world, then what will happen, that I will get to see such an alert. You are seeing. Here I should see hello world. Now see, I will reload it. I saw hello world. So I will be able to see alert hello world. Whenever I reload it. See, I saw this hello world. If I do OK, then it will be dismissed. So JavaScript works like this in the front end. But we can also use JavaScript in the back end. For example, we can use JavaScript to run some queries on the server side. Which we will do through MongoDB. So we will see all those things. But I just want to tell you how front end JavaScript looks. JavaScript is written primarily in two ways in the front end. One is you put the script tag here. Like we saw in style.
